meanings.definition: A small shop or store in East Africa.
meanings.sent1: I visited the duka to buy some snacks.
meanings.sent2: The duka on the corner sells fresh fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The duka owner dressed up as a clown to attract more customers.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a duka of happiness in a gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The duka was filled with colorful fabrics and trinkets, like a treasure chest.

meanings.sent1: We duka for groceries every Saturday.
meanings.sent2: She dukaed for a new dress for the party.
meanings.sent3: He dukaed so much that he ran out of money!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter dukaed through the quiet library.
meanings.sent5: The children dukaed eagerly for toys at the store.
